intro: Euphrasia kisoalpina, commonly known as the Kiso alpine eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its small, yellowish flowers are clustered in whorls along the stem, and it has hairy, linear leaves. Euphrasia kisoalpina is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
